page.title: 09LANDSCAPE
page.content: Ivinghoe Beacon. The Beacon is a prominent feature on the local landscape.It is part of the range of hills known as the Chilterns and at its highest point is 750 feet above sea level.On the top of the Beacon there is a triangulation point for the Ordnance Survey and at times of national celebration signal fires have been lit on the summit.The Beacon is said to be the burial place of Iron Age chiefs but this is not established fact.Many people visit the Beacon each year,and model aeroplane enthusiasts find the Beacon an ideal site for flying their radio controlled gliders and powered planes.The paths and tracks which lead to the Beacon are now very worn from the heavy use they receive and plans for their protection are currently in hand.
